intro: Codonocephalum grande, commonly known as the large-headed codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
